properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 10:20AM CST until February 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow then Bitter Cold and Windy Tonight...

.A storm system will spread snow into the area this afternoon and
tonight, followed by an arctic cold front that will bring strong
winds and bitter cold temperatures and wind chills overnight into
Thursday morning. Snow, drifting snow and falling temperatures
will create hazardous travel conditions, especially overnight.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Mercer, Henry IL, Bureau and Putnam Counties.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Go to www.gettingaroundillinois.com for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TODAY UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY
